question.title: How to get SQLXML from OracleOpaque or alternatives?
question.body:
I have a Java 21 Sping 3 project which uses ojdbc17 and Jakarta JMS libraries. It has a class which implements the org.springframework.jms.support.MessageConverter interface and its Object fromMessage(Message msg) method which contains following code snippet:

ORAData data = (ORAData) (AQjmsAdtMessage) msg).getAdtPayload();
Struct struct = (Struct) data.toDatum(null);
Object[] attributes = struct.getAttributes();
[...]
XMLType xml = XMLType.createXML((OPAQUE) attributes[4]);
String payload = xml.getStringVal();

Both oracle.xdb.XMLType and oracle.sql.OPAQUE have become deprecated.

I have searched the net for a new way to get the result of the last two code lines. From what I understood you now should use SQLXML and OracleOpaque instead but they're just interfaces, is there an example implementation which creates SQLXML from an OracleOpaque anywhere? Or is there a different way to do this?
